intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana subsp. campestris, commonly known as the field eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported soothing properties.
